meanings.definition: To draw or pull something along the ground
meanings.sent1: The farmer draughted the heavy cart across the field.
meanings.sent2: She draughted the suitcase behind her as she walked to the bus stop.
meanings.sent3: The dog draughted the toy car with its teeth, pretending to drive.
meanings.sent4: The wind draughted the fallen leaves along the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The child draughted the stick in the sand, creating patterns.

meanings.definition: To make a preliminary sketch or plan
meanings.sent1: The architect draughted the initial design of the new building.
meanings.sent2: She draughted a rough outline before starting the detailed drawing.
meanings.sent3: The student draughted a silly doodle on the corner of the page.
meanings.sent4: The artist draughted the concept for the mural on the wall.
meanings.sent5: He draughted a map of the treasure hunt for the party.

meanings.definition: To select or enlist someone for military service
meanings.sent1: The army draughted new recruits for training.
meanings.sent2: During the war, many young men were draughted into the military.
meanings.sent3: The general jokingly draughted his cat as a soldier in the pretend army.
meanings.sent4: The commander draughted the best soldiers for the special mission.
meanings.sent5: She felt nervous when she was draughted into the army.

meanings.definition: To transfer or move livestock to another location
meanings.sent1: The rancher draughted the cattle to the new grazing field.
meanings.sent2: They draughted the sheep to the lower pasture for better grazing.
meanings.sent3: The farmer draughted the chickens to the coop before the storm.
meanings.sent4: The shepherd draughted the goats to the mountain for fresh grass.
meanings.sent5: He draughted the horses to the stable for the night.
